blackmagic.name: Blackmagic Design
blackmagic.desc: Blackmagic Design delivers production-proven tools across switching, cameras, capture/IO and post. Typical builds include ATEM switchers for live production, URSA/Studio cameras over SDI/NDI, DeckLink for ingest/playout, and HyperDeck recorders, with DaVinci Resolve for color and finishing. Ideal for studio, campus TV and hybrid events.

atem_mini.caption: ATEM Mini Extreme ISO ‚Äî live switcher core

synco.name: SYNCO
synco.desc: Compact on-camera and studio microphones for reliable on-set capture. Common use: wireless lav kits for interviews, and shotgun mics for dialogue/VO.

g2a2.caption: G2 A2 dual-channel wireless lav kit

unileader.name: Uni-Leader
unileader.desc: Uni-Leader provides integrated broadcast and virtual studio solutions ‚Äî hardware + software ‚Äî from camera switching (U-Caster 4K), compositing & CG (U-CG), to studio control (U-Studio 4K) and real-time remote learning (U-Mooc).

obsbot.name: OBSBOT
obsbot.desc: OBSBOT focuses on AI-powered PTZ and tracking cameras, offering smart framing, gesture control, and multi-mode tracking for studio, live streaming, and content creation.

acemic.name: Acemic
acemic.desc: Acemic (Honbo Audio) specialises in wireless microphone systems, in-ear monitor systems, and related audio transmission modules. Products are widely used in stage, education, broadcast, performance, and recording setups for stable, interference-resistant audio pipelines.

yamaha.name: Yamaha Mixer
yamaha.desc: Yamaha offers a full line of professional analog and digital mixers tailored for studio, live, and broadcast environments. Popular lines include the TF, DM, CL/QL, M7CL, and RIVAGE series for mixing, routing, effects, and recall workflows.

mipro.name: MIPRO
mipro.desc: MIPRO is a Taiwanese pioneer in wireless microphone, portable PA, and in-ear monitoring systems. Their patented ACT (Automatic Channel Targeting) enables fast syncing between transmitters and receivers.

mls.name: MLS LED (Êú®ÊûóÊ£Æ)
mls.desc: MLS (Êú®ÊûóÊ£Æ) specializes in high-quality LED display modules used for broadcast video walls, stage walls, and virtual set backdrops. Their modules support high refresh rates and fine pixel pitch for crisp video output.

obs.name: OBS
obs.desc: OBS Studio is a free, open-source software suite for video recording and live streaming. It supports multiple video sources, compositing, plugins, virtual cameras, and real-time scene switching.

unreal.name: Unreal Engine
unreal.desc: Unreal Engine is a real-time 3D creation tool used for games, virtual studios, and broadcast graphics. It powers virtual sets, real-time rendering, and interactive visuals.

ndi.name: NDI
ndi.desc: NDI (Network Device Interface) is a low-latency IP video protocol that enables video sources, audio, and metadata to be shared across networks. It powers many modern video workflows in broadcast and content production.

streamdeck.name: StreamDeck
streamdeck.desc: StreamDeck is a hardware macro controller that lets operators map buttons to actions, shortcuts, or scene changes ‚Äî greatly enhancing live workflow efficiency.
